column4: Installing the linksys card with instructions from http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-618759.html didnt work
wrong firmware?? what do I do?
Linksys wireless G pic.  WMP54G
pic=pci
need more info; what exact errors, what steps failed etc
uh you are on here; why not get it and transfer it over via usbkey?
what is the chipset, nevermind the brand name
you talking to me? use my nick (type baz then hit tab) and I can follow more easily
Yes
Where do I find out the chipset?
what does lspci show (if pci card)
Doesnt list it.. shows everything but my linksys card
what about lsusb for a usb card then
what do you mean a usbcard?
external usb plug in thing
that mean I gota go buy somthing else? lol.. I just got this card like 2 months ago lol
I think I might need to go back to windows lol
your choice really
I want to use ubuntu but I only have an option for wireless internet
lsusb shows nothing
well you need to give us the chipset before we can proceed; mentioning going back to windows is not a motivator for people *volunteering* to help you
well how else may I look up the chipset?
please paste output of ifconfig and lspci to pastebin
that is a pcmcia card? best not to hotplug those--could damage your motherboard
